laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan of the petrous temporal bones
laboratory_examinations.findings: Bone of the otic capsule is thickened but has much lower than normal attenuation. This undemineralized bone pattern has a bilateral symmetric distribution and extensive involvement around the cochleae, vestibules, and semicircular canals, with obliteration of the oval windows.
T1-weighted images show enhancement of the fundus of the distal internal auditory canals and of the bones around the cochleae, vestibules, and semicircular canals bilaterally. No mass lesion is seen.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Conventional radiograph of the tibia and fibula
laboratory_examinations.findings: Multiple healed fractures of the tibia transfix by an intramedullary rod, as well as an un-united fracture deformity of the middle fibular shaft. The bones are gracile and osteoporotic.
